results.title: Distillation
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit, Sir Arthur Hallam Elton and Peter Baylis
results.brief_description: An explanation of the fundamentals of distillation illustrates by examples of methods used in the fractional distillation of crude oil. Studies the following: size of atoms; structure of the hydrocarbon molecules; crude oil mixture of different compounds which are separated for commercial use into petrol and lubricating oils; fractional distillation of mixtures of hydro-carbons by laboratory and industrial processes.

results.title: Distemper in dogs
results.brief_description: Describes how distemper in dogs may be treated and how the disease may be prevented from affecting healthy dogs by the use of appropriate injections.

results.title: Distant neighbours
results.creator_credit: Greenpark Productions, British Petroleum, Humphrey Swingler and John Durst
results.brief_description: Illustrates the importance of light aircraft in maintaining communications with remote settlements, showing services operating in the Isle of Barra in the Outer Hebrides, in the frozen North-West Territory of Canada and in the desert outback of Central Australia.

results.title: Distant islands
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jack Long and Bettina Maylone
results.brief_description: As in her previous film, the award-winning The Hometown, the filmmaker has used applique and embroidered tapestries to animate a story from her childhood. Distant Islands recalls a young girl’s happy summers spent sailing with her family off the coast of British Columbia. Each tapestry, meticulously stitched by hand with brightly colored yarns, evokes a memory of leisurely days at sea, drifting among the islands.

results.title: Distant harmony
results.brief_description: A joyous celebration of Luciano Pavarotti’s sensational 1986 China tour. The beauty of Pavarotti’s soaring voice combines with the cultural magic of imperial China to reaffirm the universality of art through the glories of Italian opera. Accompanied by the Genoa Opera Company, with whom performed ‘La Boheme’, Pavarotti’s natural gregariousness and great talent make him a larger-than-life presence and a perfect ambassador of culture and good will.

results.title: Distant connections
results.creator_credit: CSIRO, Nicholas Alexander and Tony Chenn
results.brief_description: A study of the plant life found in Tasmania and its relationship with plants now extinct or rare on the mainland of Australia. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Dispute
results.creator_credit: Basic Films, Leon Clore and Fred Moore
results.brief_description: A study of a typical industrial dispute and the real reason behind it. A personal incident between an operative and a foreman grows, until the whole factory is brought to a stand-still. Concentrates in turn on the operative, the foreman, the shop steward and the factory manager, showing how each of them came to take the attitude he did and how each felt he had no alternative and was unable to withdraw.

results.title: Disney Masterclass with Roy Conli and Glen Keane [excerpt]
results.brief_description: Glen Keane has been with the Walt Disney Studios for over 25 years and is best known for his character animations for feature films such as ‘The Little Mermaid’, ‘Aladdin’, ‘Beauty and the Beast’, ‘Tarzan’, and ‘Tangled’. In this masterclass, as part of the Disney : Dreams Come True exhibition at ACMI, Keane discusses the innate ability for children to express emotion through drawing and the inspiration for the character ‘Ariel’ in ‘The Little Mermaid’.
